moving

Class NPC

  • java.lang.Object
    • moving.NPC

  • public class NPC
extends java.lang.Object
    An NPC is a character that talks to the player but cannot be played by the player. NPC's can be customized to talk to you and/or give items.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NPC

        public NPC(int x,
   int y,
   java.lang.String firstMessage,
   java.lang.String[] messages,
   java.lang.String[] unlockedMessages,
   int recycle,
   java.awt.Image img,
   Item[] items)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the NPC.
        y - The y-position of the NPC.
        firstMessage - The first message that the NPC will say. This message will be seen exactly once by the player, and that's at the beginning of the NPC's text.
        messages - An array of Strings that represent the LOCKED messages that the NPC will say. See the UnlockedMessage class to see more about locked vs. unlocked messges.
        unlockedMessages - An array of Strings that represent the UNLOCKED messages that the NPC will say. See the UnlockedMessage class to see more about locked vs. unlocked messges.
        recycle - How the NPC "recycles" his messages; i.e. repeats all messages from the beginning, or just stays at the last message, etc. See final constants above.
        img - The NPC Image.
        items - An array of items that the NPC will drop. The NPC drops these items when you talk to him and he says his second-to-last message.

    • Method Detail

      • drawNPC

        public void drawNPC(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the NPC.
        Parameters:
        g - The object on which the graphics is drawn.

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(Game myGame)
        Updates the NPC's position and checks for collision.
        Parameters:
        myGame - A copy of the current Game.

      • getMessage

        public Message getMessage(Game myGame)
        Fetches the correct message to display. Automatically keeps track of which message the player will see next.
        Parameters:
        myGame - A copy of the current Game.
        Returns:
        The correct message to display.
